intro: Sclerophylax kurtzii, commonly known as the Kurts' hard-leaved plant, is a species native to specific regions of Africa. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are adapted to conserve water in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in areas with limited rainfall. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in shades of white or pale yellow. Sclerophylax kurtzii is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
